intro: Guilleminea lanuginosa var. tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered guilleminea, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a soft, fuzzy appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments. This variety is noted for its delicate structure and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
